title.narrative: ADOLESCENTS PROTECTION

description.narrative: By 2025, more adolescents are agents in making Somalia safer for themselves and other children., which contributes to Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children are safer and better protected from violence, abuse, exploitation and harm.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, more adolescents are agents in making Somalia safer for themselves and other children.

description.narrative: The first year of the Adolescent protection programme has impacted key sectors such as GBV, CAAFAG reintegration, but reaching scale remains a challenge. ;In 2021,the Safe Schools curriculum was rolled out to 1016 girls and up to 55.7% of girls showed change in level of knowledge on GBV and life skills. The UPSHIFT Social Innovation and Entrepreneurship program reached 185 youths (M-97/F-88) in Somaliland and Puntland while the Diversion Program reached 1,289 (1,095 boys, 184 girls) young people of ages 14-17 C/YiCWL with screening, case management and enrolment in life skills and PSS programmes with CSO partners. ; | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/01/2022
